Android surpassed Symbian to become the world's No. 1 smart phone software in the fourth quarter of last year, according to the Canalys research firm. Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer said the partnership would give the team more innovation, greater global reach and scale. "We need to, and we will, collaborate closely on development... so we can really align and drive the future revolution of the mobile phone," he said.

This clash of the tech titans is captured by POLITICO's Elizabeth Wasserman in a slice of the type of reporting you can expect from POLITICO Pro. Google is under siege in Washington like never before- and it says an "anti-Google industrial complex' is to blame. In an interview with POLITICO, a Google spokesman argued that a cabal of antitrust lawyers, lobbyists and public relations firms is conspiring against the Internet search giant. The mastermind? Google says it's Microsoft, Wasserman reports. "Maybe it's irony, or maybe it"s payback. "As the CEO of a biotechnology company, Senator Kirsten Gillibrand 's initiative is extremely important to us," said Dr. Joan Fallon, Curemark founder and CEO. By supporting cutting edge research in the biotechnology field, and thus allowing for innovation, these R&D tax credits will help to defray the costs of basic research and clinical programs, which can be prohibitive to the small biotech companies. We at Curemark are extremely grateful for the Senator's leadership on this issue. Senator Kirsten Gillibrand 's proposal would expand the current credit by changing the formula to provide greater incentive for companies such as Curemark to increase investment; simplify the current credit, which is highly complicated and confusing;
